intro: Dielytra eximia, commonly known as the scarlet lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically red or orange in color. Its leaves are grass-like and arranged in a fan shape, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Dielytra eximia is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds and streams.
